title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Two phone/video interviews and then an all day on site interview. On site met with several people on campus to discuss experience and job responsibilities. They asked several questions focusing on skills and how skills are related to college age students and a counseling center.
Interview Questions: How do your skills transfer to a campus environment?

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Process was so long (3+ months) and some interviews were 3+ hours. there was a combination of Phone calls, zoom and in person interviews. Called references multiple times throughout the whole process
Interview Questions: What is your coaching style

title: Library Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview. Applied through Handshake with my resume and cover letter. Interview was basically a working interview. I think if you get an interview you already got the job
Interview Questions: What is your work experience?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Super quick with an incredibly friendly staff. They asked questions about my ability to grade and be anonymous and unbiased.  I have to work critically and give accurate grades based on my personal work ethic.
Interview Questions: If I'm a critical analist.

title: Development Officer, Annual Fund Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews total. One a kind of screening interview, one with the search committee, and and one with many members of the team. They were fantastic, but it was an intense interview process. The final interview was over 2 hours long.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Bucknell?

title: TLC Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Standard for most student jobs, helped that I knew some of the people and that you have to be nominated beforehand. Very relaxed, but with clear expectations. Ultimately, I enjoyed it.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: TLC College Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Focused on your grades and professor recommendation. Just stick to the basics and explain why you are interested in the job. They look for students who did exceptionally well and can help others
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with the TLC

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple online application. I applied and was notified of the interview time and location. I attended and then was offered the position a couple of days later. I am very pleased with this process and appreciated how smoothly everything was handled.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was scheduled over email and it was quick and easy-going. Not too complicated. Best to go over position thoroughly and be prepared to be asked very specific questions.
Interview Questions: Why would you want this position? What makes you qualified? What are your weaknesses and how will you address them going forward?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: good experience and expectations were all met so it went very well i enoyed the interview very much thank you so much for the opportunity to interview here  for a role that doesnt face the entitled students
Interview Questions: why do you wnt to work here

title: Director, Diversity Equity and Inclusion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bucknell University in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: First round interview was oddly intrusive. No questions about fitness. Asked me what salary I wanted, and why I was leaving the last place. They said it was a screening but they also asked me to justify giving me a second round interview
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that would match with the job duties?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I spoke directly with the head of the research team who is also a professor. She was very polite and professional. We spoke in person about the open position and about my interest level.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join the research team?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was nothing I never got interviewed, they needed teaching assistants for labs and so an email is sent out asking for a list of people who are interested and then they are chosen. its very easy.
Interview Questions: there were no questions asked

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: Simple process, typical questions for an intern, and the offices are very encouraging. The interviewers are always polite and always looking out for the best for their students and the university community
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: None, you are nominated to the position by a teacher that believes you would be a good fit for the learning center. Or, you can be peer nominated to the position!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Library Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Bucknell University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very Simple, must demonstrate basic knowledge of computer and willingness to learn. Do you know how to be polite, do you know how to ask your supervisors for help when you need it, can you use the internet to solve problem when you're on your own and need to solve a problem?
Interview Questions: What do you know about technology, and how have you been able to help someone with their problems with technology?

title: Residential Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Bucknell University
Interview Descriptions: I thought that the interview was good overall. I felt comfortable in the environment, but I also felt like my skills were being assessed adequately. The conversation was easy and the questions were pretty straightforward. I didn't feel like I was getting pinned or pushed far to see how I would react. I got the sense that the interview was very important to the Office of Residential Education when I was participating in the interview.
Interview Questions: What is a hall program I would plan?

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
Initial 45 minute phone interview with library and IT team. 
Invited to all day visit on campus. This day began at 8:00am and ended at 3:30pm. I had the chance to meet with numerous managers ranging from my direct supervisor to the CIO.
Interview Questions:
strengths/weaknesses
what do you know about Bucknell? 
what type of management style do you prefer?
describe the processes for query optimization. 
why should we hire you?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position through the Bridge, the job search page of the university. After a couple of days, I received an email asking me to set up a time for a face to face interview. The interview had two parts. First, I was asked about the position and why I would be interested in becoming a student caller. Second, there was a simulation of a mock call that I had to undertake.
Interview Questions:
Why would you be interested in this position?
How does your background prepare you to be successful at it?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very open-ended, behavorial questions that are intended to show how involved you are on campus. You will be interviewed by current tour guides and there will be other candidates interviewing at the same time with you.
Interview Questions: Q: What activities are you involved on campus?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bucknell University in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: One on one phone interview, followed by a group phone interview, followed by a trip to Lewisburg for several one on one interviews then a group interview. Was offered the job three days after the in-person interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your technical experience?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sent in application and then had a 2-on-1 interview. This was with the head of the program and one of the senior employees. All the questions involved why I like Bucknell and what I would do in a situation where an alum was upset with the school.
Interview Questions: Why do you like Bucknell? I was also asked to do a mock phone call

title: French Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: This position is usually on a referral basis. I had a Professor contact me and ask if I was interested in being a TA.If interested, as a Professor in your desired department.
Interview Questions: What are some of your ideas as a TA?

title: Equipment Services Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Student managers asked me questions pertaining to customer service and various technologies which the equipment services desk is known to loan.  I was also interviewed by the head equipment services supervisor, who is now my boss.  She asked similar questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at equipment services?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA)
Interview Descriptions: After the application, which was brief, I was contacted almost immediately for an interview.  The interview process was informal and consisted mostly of basic technology questions and a survey of my customer service skills.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't any

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Ask about your major GPA and ask you to talk about yourself. Then check your credit hours to see if you have enough spare time to finish grading before deadline.
Interview Questions: Talk about yourself

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bucknell University (Lewisburg, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: In order to get an interview, I was recommended to the staff by several professors. After a 2 on 1 interview, there is a group interview in which you brainstorm ways to deal with different scenarios. The whole process takes a while but is pretty easy and they didn't turn anybody down. This was when the process was being refined though so it may have changed since then.
Interview Questions: What classes would you have the skill base to tutor for?
